About me

In 2018, I started a postdoc position at Computer Science Department (DCC) of the University of Chile (Faculty of Engineering).

During 2016-18, I worked as a teacher at National University of Quilmes, and also as developer of web applications.

In 2015, I've got a Ph.D. at University of Lille under the supervision of Stéphane Ducasse and Damien Cassou. I was part of RMoD research group at Inria. In my thesis I've worked in software evolution, first-class code changes, code integration activities, and untangling code changes.

Previously, I've studied at Computer Department of the University of Buenos Aires, where I received my degree in Computer Sciences. In my master thesis, I worked in Fuel, an object serialization framework for Pharo, which has been adopted by the community. My supervisors were Hernán Wilkinson, Carlos E. Ferro, and Stéphane Ducasse.

During my master I've programmed many years for consulting and software development companies such as Hexacta.

Some interests

  • Object-oriented programming languages
  • Impact analysis of source code changes
  • Software comprehension
  • Software evolution and maintenance
  • Software visualization
  • Mining software repositories
